definition: to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: These great embody the women - oriented form of a matriarchal society in sight.
sentences.chinese: 这些体现着妇女为大为主的母系社会形态的迹象。

sentences.english: That is due to the matriarchy of its society.
sentences.chinese: 那是因为他们仍然是母系社会。

sentences.english: As a matrilineal society, they valued women over men, and inheritance was passed from mother to daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他们属于母系社会，观念上重女轻男，由女子继承。

sentences.english: The geisha women live in a strictly matriarchal society.Women dominate.
sentences.chinese: 艺妓生活在一个严格的母系社会中，妇女占主导地位。

sentences.english: Bafipo was a matrilineal society and a settled agricultural community.
sentences.chinese: 半坡属于母系社会，是以农业为主的定居村落。

sentences.english: In matrilinear societies the real head of the family is the mother's brother.
sentences.chinese: 在母系社会中，家庭里真正的头领是妈妈的兄弟。

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
Mosuo ethnic group of Yunnan and Sichuan
to regard men as superior to women (idiom)
